channel.title: Tales
channel.description: Traditional fairy tales aren’t exactly suitable for kids. Women vomit spiders. Children get eaten. There’s even murder! Every Wednesday, we take you through the twists and turns of the dark origins of your favorite pieces of folklore. Tales is a Spotify Original from Parcast.

item.title: The Fairy Serpent
item.description: In medieval China, the King of Snakes catches an intruder and lets him go… with a proposal. If he wants to keep his freedom, he’ll have to marry his daughter to a monster. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Green Eyes
item.description: In this Spanish folktale, a deep pool in a mystical glen is guarded by a wicked spirit. By the time you’re in her gaze, it’s already too late. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Faithful Johannes Pt. 2
item.description: When the boy-king Frederick kidnaps a princess, he unknowingly puts a plot in motion that Johannes tries desperately to stop. But is one loyal servant enough to save a kingdom? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Faithful Johannes Pt. 1
item.description: In Germany, a dying king leaves his loyal servant one last instruction: keep the prince away from an enchanted portrait hidden inside the castle. Johannes intends to obey, but the prince is ensnared in a curse nonetheless.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Man-Eating Onibaba
item.description: With a bone-white face and glowing red eyes, the Onibaba of Adachigahara is a bloodthirsty goblin from Japanese folklore. Disguised as an old woman, she welcomes an unwitting Buddhist priest into her home. Soon, he finds that he’s taken refuge with the unfriendliest host imaginable. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Kora and His Sister
item.description: In this Eastern Indian folktale, a single act of rebellion from a young girl throws her community into a rage. The rules say she must die. But her brother has something else in mind for her: marriage… to himself. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Princess and the Pea
item.description: Having a list of preferred qualities in a partner is a classic dating trope. But if Prince Erik wants to find a wife, he’ll have to abide by someone else’s list – his mother’s. And her list comes with a catch. If a princess doesn’t measure up… she gets killed. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Melusina’s Revenge Pt. 2
item.description: Cursed by her mother, Melusina has 15 years to find true love… or turn into a monster forever. But just when she thinks she has the curse beat, she realizes that trust is a rare thing indeed. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Melusina’s Revenge Pt. 1
item.description: When a half-human fairy learns the truth about her father, she sets out to reclaim her birthright… no matter the cost.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: East of the Sun, West of the Moon Pt. 3
item.description: With the fate of her family hanging in the balance, Ingrid crashes a wedding and confronts the Troll Queen. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: East of the Sun, West of the Moon Pt. 2
item.description: Desperate to find out who she’s really married to, Ingrid breaks the one vow of her marriage and looks upon the bear king’s true face. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: East of the Sun, West of the Moon Pt. 1
item.description: This classic Norwegian tale is an epic love story, dressed in ice. It follows a girl named Ingrid and the terrifying, murderous, magical polar bear king who takes her as his wife. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ghost Stories: The Raven
item.description: In our fourth and final adaptation of Edgar Allan Poe’s most macabre tales, a midnight visitor interrupts the silent, mournful reveries of a grieving widower. From Haunted Places: Ghost Stories, a Spotify Original from Parcast. New heart-racing stories every Thursday. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ghost Stories: The Masque of the Red Death
item.description: Can you ever escape a plague? When a privileged soon-to-be doctor seeks shelter from a deadly disease, he learns no place is safe from the terror of death. This is the third episode in our Edgar Allan Poe takeover, originally airing on Haunted Places: Ghost Stories, a Spotify Original from Parcast. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ghost Stories: The Tell-Tale Heart
item.description: Continuing our Edgar Allan Poe takeover, this is The Tell-Tale Heart. Caring for the ailing and eldery has taken its toll on Philip Langdon. He insists on his sanity, but proof of his deteriorating mental health lies pulsing beneath the surface. From Haunted Places: Ghost Stories, a Spotify Original from Parcast.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ghost Stories: The Fall of the House of Usher
item.description: This week we’re celebrating the genius of Edgar Allan Poe with four chilling tales, starting with The Fall of the House of Usher. Sickly and desperate, Roderick Usher calls upon a childhood friend to join him in his ancestral home. There, the weight of the Usher family’s wicked legacy threatens to overwhelm them both. This episode first aired on Haunted Places: Ghost Stories, a Spotify Original from Parcast.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Three Little Blue Stones
item.description: In this Portuguese fairytale, a young princess leaves her suffocating life behind, only to find that freedom comes with its own perils.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Not to be Taken at Bed-Time
item.description: From an Irish writer who specialized in spooky melodrama, this is a revenge story interrupted by a love story. But you won’t find any happy endings here. Only a heavy fog, and a tragic plot brewed by bitterness. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Rumpelstiltskin
item.description: When a young woman is told to do the impossible and spin straw into gold, she makes a dangerous deal with an imp who can help her. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Best of 2021: At the Seance
item.description: As we look ahead to the new year, we want to take one last chance to say thank you for the year that was — and present our "Best of 2021"! Please enjoy this episode from Mediums, one of our favorite new shows of this year, where we take you straight into the heart of a 19th-century seance. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Lost Nativity: An Apocryphal Christmas Tale
item.description: Dark, sweeping, and brimming with cosmic significance — this is the nativity story as you’ve never heard it before. Join us for a pulse-pounding tale sourced from ancient texts and apocryphal gospels, featuring scenes that didn’t quite make it into the Bible. This is a storytelling special from Parcast Network, hosted by Vanessa Richardson and Alastair Murden. Coming up: A prophecy unfolds, and a child — unlike any other — is born…  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Twelve Months
item.description: This Slavic tale finds a young woman faced with impossible tasks from her stepmother. While facing certain death, she receives help from the Twelve Months. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Deacon of Myrká
item.description: In this tale from Iceland, undying love is anything but romantic. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Wives of Okuninushi
item.description: In this story from Japan, a jealous princess sets a trap for her husband’s first wife. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Superstitions: Wishbone
item.description: Everything can change in a snap. In this Thanksgiving special from Superstitions, a Spotify Original from Parcast, breaking the wishbone can change your luck and your life… in wonderful and terrible ways. Search and follow Superstitions for more episodes like this one, diving into eerie codes of conduct that can sway the fates. New episodes Wednesdays! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Snow Child
item.description: Just before Christmas, a seafaring merchant returns to his family and finds that it has grown, miraculously, in his absence. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Child Monster
item.description: In this Inuit folktale from Greenland, two orphans flee a bloodthirsty monster — only to find new horrors await them in the wild. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Golden Maiden
item.description: An Armenian folk tale follows a tenacious heroine who will stop at nothing to save her enchanted brother. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Season of the Witch: The Witch Who Steals Children’s Hearts
item.description: There's a kindly old woman in the village who makes it her job to comfort grieving parents. But as some of her neighbors soon discover, her generosity may have more sinister motives.Season of the Witch is a special storytelling series across Parcast Network. Follow Superstitions and Haunted Places to find more spooky stories and historical haunts! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Season of the Witch: An Abenaki Witch Story
item.description: Young Iris has no connection to her Abenaki heritage... until she accidentally spends the night in an ancient graveyard. After a witch attacks, Iris rejoins her people to fight for the fate of her husband's soul.Season of the Witch is a special storytelling series across Parcast Network. Follow Superstitions and Haunted Places to find more spooky stories and historical haunts!  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Season of the Witch: King Kindness and the Witch
item.description: A vengeful witch tries to reclaim control of the forest after an intruder ignites a rebellion. Season of the Witch is a special storytelling series across Parcast Network. Follow Superstitions and Haunted Places to find more spooky stories and historical haunts! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Season of the Witch: The Magic Wand
item.description: Young Katie can't wait to be an adult. So when a witch with a magic wand helps her dreams come true, Katie never wants to go back home... until she learns the witch's cannibalistic secret.Season of the Witch is a special storytelling series across Parcast Network. Follow Superstitions and Haunted Places to find more spooky stories and historical haunts! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Buttercup
item.description: This Norwegian folktale follows a young boy caught in a terrifying cat-and-mouse game with a witch. And while his situation vaguely resembles other “home alone” tales, this one has a dark and bloody ending.… Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Woman Who Loved a Serpent
item.description: This Passamaquoddy tale follows a boy who tries to find a home with his mother's tribe — but instead, discovers an evil disease. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Augean Stables
item.description: This Greek saga follows Hercules on one of his infamous Labors. Instead of battling a violent, mythical beast, however, he faced a challenge that tested his cleverness… and his stomach. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Death of the Seven Dwarfs
item.description: This Swiss fairy tale takes a look at the dark things that can happen at a remote forest cottage... and reminds us that not all good Samaritans are rewarded for their deeds. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Red Buffalo Woman
item.description: This traditional West African folk tale chronicles the life of Oya, a shape-shifting deity who must make a difficult choice between family and her secret life as a wild animal. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: One Good Turn Deserves Another Pt. 2
item.description: In the dramatic conclusion of Prince Milorad's tale, our hero fights back against his traitorous servant by drawing on his own unique strengths. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: One Good Turn Deserves Another Pt. 1
item.description: In this Serbian folk tale, a sensitive prince helps a prisoner in need, but ends up banished from his father's kingdom. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Why the Sea Moans
item.description: This Brazilian legend follows the adventures of a runaway princess and a sea monster — through friendship, bloodshed, and betrayal. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Cannetella
item.description: This classic Italian fairy tale features a princess named Cannetella who refuses to marry. She has other, more important plans for her life. But when she’s tricked into wedding an evil sorcerer, she’ll make another vow: to escape the grasp of her beastly betrothed, and undo his plot for revenge. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Boy Who Became a Goblin
item.description: He didn’t think goblins were real until he was kidnapped by them. This Swedish fairy tale follows a young troublemaker who discovers the goblins have a more sinister plan for him than he ever could have imagined. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Scheherazade & Her Stories Pt. 2
item.description: As Scheherazade's wild tales come to end, we learn what becomes of her once she finally runs out of stories to tell her murderous husband. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Scheherazade & Her Stories Pt. 1
item.description: The frame story of The Arabian Nights, the tale of Scheherazade tells us how a woman saved a kingdom with only her wits... and 1001 days of patience. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Blue Light
item.description: In this Brothers Grimm classic, a war veteran discovers a magical light that grants wishes, and learns that you should be careful what you wish for. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Vampire Cat of Nabéshima
item.description: In this Japanese folktale, a shapeshifting demon in the form of a cat terrorizes a prince — until a devoted soldier steps forward to protect him. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Solstice Special: Neptune and Delphinus
item.description: In this early Greek tale, we learn the genesis of the constellation Delphinus. A tricky dolphin helps Neptune, the God of the Sea, track down the love of his life. As a sign of thanks, Neptune immortalizes Delphinus with his very own stars.For more celestial stories, keep listening across Parcast Network for episodes on the Zodiac signs, constellations and more! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Solstice Special: Ursa Major
item.description: Long before Ursa Major was a collection of stars, she was a huntress named Callisto. A violent encounter with the god Jupiter and his wife Juno leads to her first transformation, and sets her on a collision path with a very special hunter. For more celestial stories, keep listening across Parcast Network for episodes on the Zodiac signs, constellations and more!  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Boy with the Golden Stars
item.description: This Romanian fairy tale follows a wicked stepmother who tries to get rid of two magical princes. But buried secrets always have a way of coming to light. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Two Brothers and 49 Dragons
item.description: This classic Greek folktale follows a poor man who swipes some gold to feed his starving family — and inadvertently draws the wrath of 49 terrifying dragons. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Kajong and Haloek
item.description: In this Vietnamese folk story, a mistreated young woman escapes the wrath of her aunt and cousin in order to marry the king. But she doesn't count on their final act of cruelty. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Magic School
item.description: In this Icelandic folk tale, three boys find themselves in a subterranean school with a horrifying headmaster. If they don’t pass the final exam, their punishment will be eternal… Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Foolish Friend
item.description: This Indian fable tells the story of a king whose choice of companions leads to his downfall — and a pool of blood on palace grounds. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The New Mother
item.description: This Victorian English tale chronicles two young girls who misbehave so badly, they drive away their mother. But they don’t count on the terrible consequences of their naughty behavior — a terrifying new mother with piercing eyes and a heavy tail. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: A Year and a Day
item.description: An Irish folktale about a family’s desperate and otherworldly hunt to find their missing daughter. Only through trust and perseverance will they have a chance to succeed. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Twelve Huntsmen Pt. 2
item.description: In the dramatic conclusion of this Brothers Grimm story, a spurned princess' quest for vengeance turns into a deadlier hunt than she ever imagined. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Twelve Huntsmen Pt. 1
item.description: In this classic Brothers Grimm tale, a jilted princess is determined to get revenge against her former lover… by any means necessary. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Story of Zoolvisia Pt. 2
item.description: After combining forces, Prince Samos and Zoolvisia must battle against a powerful woman and an evil king. Along the way, they discover something more dangerous than magic…  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Story of Zoolvisia Pt. 1
item.description: In this Armenian fairy tale, Prince Samos battles the most powerful witch in the forest, Zoolvisia. But the witch isn't the only one in the forest with magic… Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Giant Who Had No Heart in His Body
item.description: In this ancient Norwegian tale, a prince goes on a quest to find his brother. Along the way, he discovers a princess held by an evil giant. Despite his father’s warnings not to trust strangers, it might be the only way to rescue both the princess and his brother. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Field of Boliauns
item.description: In this classic Irish folktale, a lazy, young farmer stumbles onto a leprechaun and immediately thinks his future is paved with gold. But this leprechaun isn't the usual green-suited man of legends... He's crafty, ornery, and very possibly deadly. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Painted Skin
item.description: This 17th-century Chinese story tells the tale of a young, married businessman who meets a beautiful concubine. He brings her home, thinking his life will be perfect — only to realize she is hiding a deadly secret…  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Tale of the Three Apples
item.description: One of the earliest murder mysteries comes from One Thousand and One Nights, a collection of Middle Eastern folk tales. After a dead body is found in the Tigris River, the caliph’s adviser is tasked with solving the crime. If he fails, he and his family will suffer a similar fate… Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Jack and the Beanstalk Pt. 2
item.description: The stranger's beans led Jack to the land of the giants... but will he be able to escape? And how will the discovery of a dangerous magical land save him from poverty? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Jack and the Beanstalk Pt. 1
item.description: An iconic tale, this story tells how a young boy makes a foolhardy gamble to save himself and his mother from starvation. Would you sell your only hope for a handful of magic beans? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Of the Pretty Girl and the Seven Jealous Women
item.description: In this ancient Ibibio tale, beauty is a questionable gift for a young heroine who just wants some friends to visit a festival with. Instead, she finds herself wrapped up in a story of betrayal — and brutal revenge. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Wicked Old Man of the Sea
item.description: In this ancient Finnish folk tale, a fisherman is forced to give his daughters to the evil sea spirit, Wetehinen. After two daughters disobey the supernatural being, he kills them. But the fisherman's youngest daughter devises a plan to bring her sisters back to life, and destroy Wetehinen once and for all. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Mangita & Larina
item.description: From the Philippines, this folktale personifies goodness and wickedness in the form of two rival siblings. But it’s not only a lesson in morality — it’s an origin story for a lake event that’s tied to the Pasig River. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Hansel & Gretel Pt. 2
item.description: As the truth of their abandonment sinks in, Hansel and Gretel begin to despair — until the tantalizing smell of gingerbread leads them to a house of sweets. But the sugary cottage hides a rotten core, and the children are left to determine how to outwit a witch. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Hansel & Gretel Pt. 1
item.description: In the midst of a famine, a father and his wife lead their children deep into a forest. They mean to leave them there in a desperate bid for survival. And though Hansel and Gretel prove to be clever and capable, their stepmother is a determined adversary. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Little Match Girl
item.description: Barefoot and dejected, a young girl tries in vain to sell matches on a frigid New Year’s Eve. As the temperature dips ever lower, she strikes matches for herself, and has visions of an all-embracing warmth.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: A Christmas Carol Pt. 2
item.description: He’s faced his ghosts, and reckoned with his past. But after decades of relentless self-enrichment, how can Scrooge truly redeem himself? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: A Christmas Carol Pt. 1
item.description: A miserly old man. A long-dead business partner. And the sound of rattling chains… In this iconic ghost story by Charles Dickens, Ebenezer Scrooge is forced to look back through his life and ponder when he lost his humanity.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Old Woman Who Was Skinned
item.description: This disturbing folktale from the 17th century tells of two elderly, impoverished sisters who pull a prank on a king using tallow and twine. But when their ruse is discovered, only one is left unscathed. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Lady Eleanore’s Mantle
item.description: In 18th century Boston, a bewitching woman wraps herself in pride as a doctor scrambles to prevent an outbreak of smallpox.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Cecilio, the Servant of Emilio
item.description: After demanding his freedom from a plantation owner, a young orphan makes his way into a world filled with dangerous rogues and life-saving magic.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Mythical Monsters Crossover: Questing Beast
item.description: Today we’re bringing you a special episode from another Spotify Original from Parcast. If you enjoy it, check out Mythical Monsters on Spotify, or wherever you listen to podcasts! Hailing from Arthurian Legend, the Questing Beast is an enigma layered with symbolism and competing interpretations. With a bizarre appearance — and even more confounding purpose — the barking animal conjures a sense of immense strangeness. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Snow White Pt. 2
item.description: She may have escaped from the Queen's castle, but Snow White’s challenges are far from over. Will the new family she finds in the woods be enough to protect her from the queen's wrath? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Snow White Pt. 1
item.description: A brothers Grimm classic, Snow White is a truly timeless story. In this episode, experience the strange origins of the titular character, and the jealousy that made her childhood perilous... Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Zerendac & Abu Freywar
item.description: First recorded in 1904, this story is similar to France’s “Bluebeard,” with a uniquely Palestinian twist. In a land that is so often torn apart by struggle, its main character will not be taken without a fight. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Legend of Sleepy Hollow Pt. 2
item.description: After a failed proposal to the beautiful Katrina Van Tassel, Ichabod takes his heartbreak to the stables, borrowing a horse for a quick nighttime ride… where he encounters the headless terror who haunts Sleepy Hollow.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Legend of Sleepy Hollow Pt. 1
item.description: When a teacher named Ichabod Crane moves to Sleepy Hollow, he's intrigued by tales of the Headless Horseman, said to haunt the town. But he soon learns that the ghost might be more than just a story…  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Coyote Teodora
item.description: This Central American folktale is a story of love, distrust, and betrayal, set in a country that was recently colonized by the Spanish and rife with distrust and bad blood. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Changelings
item.description: Originating primarily from Ireland and Scotland, legends of the changelings can vary—but many center around the idea of fairies kidnapping a human baby, and leaving a changeling in its place.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Tale of Urashima
item.description: This 8th century Japanese folk tale is so famous, there is a statue of Urashima in Mitoyo, Kagawa. The story features a young man who leaves his family to meet the princess of the sea, only to learn that time is the ultimate thief.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Three Billy Goats Gruff
item.description: This Norwegian folktale centers around three goats trying to find food to eat, and the misunderstood troll that stands in their way. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Vasilisa the Beautiful and Baba Yaga
item.description: In this Russian Cinderella story, a young orphan is left to defend herself against her evil stepmother. But when she’s sent to fetch a light from the elusive Baba Yaga, she soon learns that her stepmother may not be her greatest problem after all.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Robber Bridegroom
item.description: Written in 1812, The Robber Bridegroom features a spirited miller's daughter who gets engaged to a wealthy stranger, only to find out that her husband-to-be has a very dark secret. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Rime of the Ancient Mariner
item.description: Written in 1798 by English poet Samuel Taylor Coleridge, this tale is adapted from Coleridge's epic poem about a proud sea captain, his doomed voyage, and his hard earned redemption. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Myrtle
item.description: Adapted by Italian poet Giambattista Basille in 1634, the tale of The Myrtle tells the story of an unconventional romance between a prince and a tree nymph, and the lengths they must go to protect their love. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Red Shoes
item.description: In this Danish fairy tale by Hans Christian Anderson, a pair of cursed red shoes force a young girl to dance herself to near insanity. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: One-Eye, Two-Eyes and Three-Eyes
item.description: This peculiar Cinderella story comes from Germany: When cruel tragedy befalls her closest friend, a young maiden named Two-Eyes takes her despair to a fairy, whose advice has enchanting results…  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Greek Cinderella
item.description: In this variation on the classic Cinderella story, a young woman’s starving sisters kill their mother… and eat her. Distraught, the woman buries her mother’s bones beneath the hearth. They transform into riches, and set young Elle off on a thrilling journey.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: King Pig
item.description: This darkly humorous tale comes from 16th century Italy. A queen gives birth to a pig, and is determined to raise him as a true and proper prince. But when the time comes for him to find a bride, his search for true love and acceptance turns deadly. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Country Where Death Is Not
item.description: In this Sudanese folktale, a man and his aging mother set out on a journey to find a land where they can live forever, only to discover the twisted reality behind its people's immortality.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Himphamp
item.description: In this Danish fairytale based on a portion of Homer's The Odyssey, a talented blacksmith is ordered by a prince to carry out a series of impossible tasks. But when the blacksmith discovers the prince is having an affair with his wife, he gets his magical revenge. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Palm-Tree Story

item.title: The Buccaneer

item.title: The Story of the Yara

item.title: The Princess in the Chest

item.title: The Tinderbox
item.description: A soldier returning from battle steals a magical Tinderbox from a witch. He uses the Tinderbox to bring himself more riches than he could have ever imagined. But what he wanted more than anything, was a chance to meet the Princess. So he used the Tinderbox to not only meet the princess, but also to become King.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ali Baba and the 40 Thieves III
item.description: After having his first revenge plot foiled, Massood, captain of the thieves, swore revenge against Ali Baba, the man who killed 37 of his men. What Massood didn’t account for was that Ali Baba was not their killer. But he would soon figure out who was. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ali Baba and the 40 Thieves II
item.description: Massood, captain of the thieves, concocts a plan to get even with Ali Baba for stealing riches from his cave. Posing as a weary oil merchant, he asks Ali Baba for a place to stay and store his 37 jars of oil. But not all the jars are full of oil...  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ali Baba and the 40 Thieves
item.description: Ali Baba, a modest wood chopper, finds a stolen fortune in a magical cave, but can't keep the secret from his greedy brother. The next time he visits the cave, he is greeted not by robbers, but by the corpse of his dead brother. Will Ali Baba be next? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Pied Piper Of Hamelin
item.description: A town in Germany had a serious rat infestation, and turned to a mysterious visitor to fix their problem. The piper played his magical fife to lure the rats to a certain doom, but the mayor reneged on the payment he promised for the service. Months later, when the piper returned, he used his powers to seek revenge... Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Mulan
item.description: The tale of Hua Mulan seems simple: she was a devoted daughter who risked her life to become a warrior in place of her father. She returned from war a hero. But an older version of this tale is dark and complex, featuring death, betrayal, and a tragic ending. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: The Ugly Duckling
item.description: In this classic story of metamorphosis, a young duckling struggles to fit in with everyone around him. He goes off on his own, only to find his feelings of depression deepen. Will he ever find the peace he is searching for, and a place where he belongs? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Bluebeard
item.description: A key. A forbidden locked door. And bloody secrets. A cautionary tale, Bluebeard warns of the danger of rich men with unchecked powers, and of the deadly risk to women who become disobedient. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Beauty and the Beast III
item.description: The Beast grants Beauty a trip home, and she gladly accepts the time with her family. On the final night of her trip, she doesn’t want to return to the Beast’s castle, even if that means the death of the Beast. But a dream leads her to rethink this decision. She rushes back, in hopes of saving his life. Will she return in time? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Beauty and the Beast II
item.description: Trapped within the Beast’s beautiful castle, Beauty grows anxious of her imminent death. In her dreams, she meets with a prince, who happens to be a fellow prisoner of the Beast. She becomes determined to save this man... before her time runs out.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Beauty and the Beast
item.description: The merchant Marc lost everything — his wife, his job, his home — leaving his children unsatisfied with their new, poor lifestyle. In a final attempt to please at least one of his twelve children, he goes to pick a lovely rose...and finds himself bargaining for his life with a beast.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Birth of a Beauty
item.description: This is the second of two prequel episodes to Beauty and the Beast. Despite different social standings, King Ernest marries a commoner, Alice. But Alice has a secret, and this secret causes her to disappear overnight, leaving the king and their daughter alone. And Alice doesn’t just disappear; her lies and secrecy get her imprisoned, and leave her poor daughter cursed.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Birth of a Beast
item.description: This is the first of two prequel episodes to Beauty and the Beast. Kidnapping. Lies. Lust. Tragedy. The original story of Beauty and the Beast is quite different than the story you know today. We go back to one of the oldest recorded versions of this classic fairy tale, starting with the violent, twisted events that lead up to a boy becoming a beast.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Welcome Trailer!
item.description: The Frog Prince. Sleeping Beauty. Beauty and the Beast.You think you know these stories, but do you really? Every Wednesday, Tales presents the original versions of fairy tales, not the popular, watered-down versions. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
